name: Darul Qasim
mission: TO FACILITATE THE LEARNING AND IMPARTING OF KNOKLEDGE DERIVED FROM PROPHETHOOD OF MUHAMMAD , ARABIC LANGUAGE AND RELIGIOUS EDUCATION
theoryOfChange: By providing rigorous academic training in the Prophetic inheritance (knowledge), the institution aims to produce scholars and professionals who can navigate modern challenges (like AI and ethics) through a sound Islamic epistemological framework.

alignment.rationale: Alignment 27/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, education global cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Build working capital reserves to 1-3 months of operating expenses
components.name: Financial Health

judge_issues.message: ZAKAT-ELIGIBLE claimed but no explicit zakat evidence found on website

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Darul Qasim earns 41/100 due to moderate alignment and limited impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.darulqasim.org/zakat (Source: https://www.darulqasim.org/zakat)

dimension_explanations.alignment: The alignment score of 27/50 represents a medium fit for donors, as the organization addresses global education needs through a traditional Islamic framework [3][6]. Its zakat-eligible status provides a clear pathway for Muslim donors to fulfill religious obligations through educational support [3][7].
dimension_explanations.impact: The impact score of 15/50 is considered low due to a focus on capacity building rather than direct service delivery, and a program expense ratio of 51.9% [1][2]. While the organization holds 29.3 months of working capital, there is limited publicly available data regarding specific beneficiary outcomes [1][4].

baseline_narrative.headline: Darul Qasim is an Islamic institution of higher learning dedicated to preserving and imparting traditional knowledge derived from the Prophethood of Muhammad.
strengths: High fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.02 per $1 raised
Strong liquidity position with 29.3 months of working capital
Clear zakat eligibility policy for eligible student support
baseline_narrative.summary: Based in Illinois, Darul Qasim facilitates religious education through programs such as the Shaykh al-Hind Program and Intermediate Islamic Studies [1][4]. The organization reported a total revenue of $3,290,091 and maintains a zakat-eligible status to support its educational mission [1][3].

rich_narrative.headline: Darul Qasim is an Islamic institution of higher learning dedicated to preserving and imparting traditional knowledge derived from the Prophethood of Muhammad.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value the preservation of traditional Islamic scholarship and want to support the long-term financial sustainability of a US-based seminary.
donor_motivations: Want to support traditional Islamic higher education in America
Value institutions with high financial stability and low fundraising overhead
Seek to fulfill zakat through student scholarships
giving_considerations: Gifts contribute to an institution with very high cash reserves
Program spending is lower than average for the sector
Focus is on long-term intellectual capacity building rather than immediate humanitarian relief
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking high-impact humanitarian relief or those who prefer charities with high immediate program spending ratios.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects <cite id="4">verified educational outcomes</cite> but a lack of independent third-party evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: By providing <cite id="6">rigorous religious education</cite>, the charity aims to produce scholars who can lead and preserve the faith.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that the curriculum effectively produces competent religious leadership.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: While the charity has high reserves, its <cite id="1">revenue growth of 23.4%</cite> suggests expanding operations.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by <cite id="2">extremely low fundraising costs</cite> compared to larger institutions like Zaytuna College.

strengths.detail: The organization demonstrates highly lean donor acquisition, spending only <cite id="2">$0.02 per $1 raised</cite>.
Darul Qasim maintains <cite id="2">29.3 months of working capital</cite>, providing a massive buffer for long-term institutional stability.
The institution has achieved a <cite id="1">3-year revenue CAGR of 23.4%</cite>, indicating increasing community support.

strengths_deep_dive: Darul Qasim's primary strength lies in its institutional maturity and financial resilience. With <cite id="1">total assets exceeding $10.2 million</cite> and <cite id="2">100% independent board members</cite>, the organization is structured for long-term sustainability. Its educational impact is delivered through a diverse range of programs, including <cite id="4">Intermediate and Advanced Islamic Studies</cite> and an <cite id="4">Iftā Program</cite>. This academic breadth is supported by a <cite id="1">diversified revenue stream</cite> that includes <cite id="1">$835,237 in program service revenue</cite> alongside traditional contributions.
rich_narrative.summary: Darul Qasim is an Illinois-based Islamic institution of higher learning dedicated to the preservation and dissemination of traditional knowledge derived from the Prophethood of Muhammad. The organization operates as a center for intellectual and spiritual growth, offering structured curricula such as the <cite id="4">Shaykh al-Hind Program</cite> and specialized <cite id="4">Takhaṣṣuṣ (Specialization) Programs</cite>. In the 2023 fiscal year, the institution reported <cite id="1">total revenue of $3,290,091</cite>, representing a significant <cite id="1">3-year revenue CAGR of 23.4%</cite>. While primarily an educational entity, Darul Qasim maintains a <cite id="3">verified zakat-eligible status</cite>, specifically utilizing these funds to support eligible students pursuing religious education. The organization's financial model is characterized by <cite id="2">exceptional fundraising efficiency</cite>, spending only <cite id="2">$0.02 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions. However, its <cite id="1">program expense ratio of 51.9%</cite> remains below the <cite id="2">peer median of 78.4%</cite>, suggesting that a substantial portion of annual revenue is currently directed toward administrative costs or capital reserves rather than direct educational delivery.
